meanings.definition: To stare intently or fixedly at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The cat outgazes the mouse, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce.
meanings.sent2: She outgazes her reflection in the mirror, trying to see if her new haircut suits her.
meanings.sent3: The little boy outgazes his vegetables, hoping they will magically disappear from his plate.
meanings.sent4: The detective outgazes the suspect, trying to read any signs of guilt in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The owl outgazes its prey, calculating the perfect angle for the attack.

meanings.definition: To look steadily or intently at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher outgazes each student during the exam to prevent cheating.
meanings.sent2: He outgazes the horizon, lost in thought about his future.
meanings.sent3: The baby outgazes the colorful mobile above the crib, mesmerized by the moving shapes.
meanings.sent4: The artist outgazes the blank canvas, envisioning the masterpiece that will come to life.
meanings.sent5: The hiker outgazes the mountain peak, determined to reach the summit before sunset.

meanings.definition: To gaze out or beyond something.
meanings.sent1: She outgazes the window, daydreaming about faraway lands she longs to visit.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut outgazes the Earth from space, marveling at its beauty and vastness.
meanings.sent3: The child outgazes the fence, imagining the adventures that lie beyond it.
meanings.sent4: The poet outgazes the city skyline, seeking inspiration for his next verse.
meanings.sent5: The sailor outgazes the open sea, feeling the call of the unknown on the horizon.
